1.text: Pour your syrup into a saucepan on low heat.

2.text: Simmer your syrup for 10 minutes as you stir it occasionally.

3.text: Use a candy thermometer to monitor the temperature until it reaches 223 °F (106 °C).

4.text: Take your syrup off the heat when it is hot enough.

5.text: Make a 1:1 ratio of cornstarch and water.

6.text: Put the syrup in a saucepan over low heat.

7.text: Pour 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of the mixture into the syrup and stir it.

8.text: Add more cornstarch mixture if you need to 1 tablespoon (15 mL) at a time.

9.text: Take your syrup off the heat and serve it while it is warm.

10.text: Simmer your syrup for 10 minutes on medium heat.

11.text: Take your syrup off the heat.

12.text: Add 1 tbsp (14 g) of powdered gelatin to your syrup.

13.text: Keep adding gelatin in 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) (14 g) increments if you need to.
